fxInfo_label: HOS removal by other in practice
fxInfo_citation: Pemstein et al. (2018, V-Dem Working Paper Series 2018:21); V-Dem Codebook (see suggested citation at the top of this document).
fxInfo_clarification: The question refers to whether any of these bodies are considered to hold this power of removal in practice, regardless of whether this is regulated by law and whether this power has been exercised or not. Choose all that apply.
fxInfo_cross_coder_aggregation: Bayesian Item Response Theory Measurement Model
fxInfo_ordering: If you select 7, proceed to the next question [v2exrmhsnl]. If you select 0-6, skip to question "HOS dissolution in practice" [v2exctlhs].
fxInfo_question: Which of the following bodies would be likely to succeed in removing the head of state if it took actions (short of military force) to do so?

fxInfo_responses.value: The ruling party or party leadership body (in a one-party system). (0=No, 1=Yes)[v2exrmhsol_2]

name: v2exrmhsol
